text: James Lane Buckley (March 9, 1923 â€“ August 18, 2023) was an American judge and politician. He was a judge for the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit.Russello, Gerald. Mr. Buckley Goes to Washington , The American Conservative He was nominated by Ronald Reagan. Before, Buckley served as a United States Senator from the state of New York. His brother was journalist William F. Buckley, Jr.. Buckley was born in New York City. In December 2019, he became the oldest living former U.S. Senator following the death of Jocelyn Burdick. Buckley turned 100 in March 2023, and died at a hospital in Washington, D.C. five months later on August 18, 2023 from problems caused by a fall. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Accidental deaths from falls in the United States Category:United States senators from New York (state) Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:American judges Category:Politicians from New York City Category:1923 births Category:2023 deaths Category:1976 United States presidential candidates Category:20th-century American politicians Category:American centenarians Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Lawyers from Connecticut Category:Writers from Connecticut Category:Writers from New York City Category:Yale University alumni
title: James L. Buckley
